forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain. Cloudy. Low around 52, with temperatures rising to around 54 overnight. Southwest wind 6 to 9 mph, with gusts as high as 21 mph. Chance of precipitation is 100%. New rainfall amounts between a half and three quarters of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Saturday
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely. Partly sunny. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 54 in the afternoon. Southwest wind 6 to 9 mph, with gusts as high as 18 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As night blankets Downtown San Francisco, the promise of rain lingers heavily in the air, a seductive reminder of the season's embrace. The temperature hovers around a cool 52 degrees, destined to rise marginally as the damp chill sets in. The skies above are cloaked in thick clouds, holding back a curtain of rain that will soon unfurl. With a firm assurance of 100% chance of precipitation, one cannot ignore the invitation to don a sturdy jacket and perhaps break out an umbrella, both essential allies in this evening's embrace of nature's wet touch.

The outlook for Saturday hints at a dance between rain and fleeting sun. A high of 58 will tease the senses but quickly retreat to a cooler 54 in the afternoon. Gusty winds from the southwest will liven up the atmosphere, whispering through the streets and rattling the leaves, a playful companion to the moisture that will gently fall from above. While the air might be fresh with the scent of rain, it also suggests a day spent indoors – perhaps a cozy coffee shop where the warmth of a cup contrasts with the chill outside, or tucked into a favorite book at home. Embrace the coming rain as a call to reflect; it’s a time for quietude, layered with the subtle melody of raindrops tapping against window panes.
